timeline.author: pruivo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+[id='quick_start']
+= Get Up and Running with {brandname}
+It's easy to get started with {brandname}. All you need is Java, dependency
+management tooling, and either the {brandname} server or core libraries.
+
+== Software Requirements
+
+To run {brandname}, you'll need:
+
+* Java 1.8 JDK at a minimum. {brandname} recommends JDK 11 but also works with JDK 14.
+* Maven 3.2 or later. {brandname} also works with Gradle and Ivy.
+
+== JDK
+Choose your Java runtime and follow their installation instructions. For example, you could choose:
+
+*  link:http://openjdk.java.net/install/[OpenJDK]
+*  link:http://www.java.com/en/download/manual.jsp[Oracle Java SE]
+
+== Maven
+Follow the official Maven installation guide if you don't already have Maven 3.2 installed.

timeline.bodyText:
quay.io or dockerhub link?
ps. assuming community docs
timeline.author: pruivo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+[id='quick_start']
+= Get Up and Running with {brandname}
+It's easy to get started with {brandname}. All you need is Java, dependency
+management tooling, and either the {brandname} server or core libraries.
+
+== Software Requirements
+
+To run {brandname}, you'll need:
+
+* Java 1.8 JDK at a minimum. {brandname} recommends JDK 11 but also works with JDK 14.
+* Maven 3.2 or later. {brandname} also works with Gradle and Ivy.
+
+== JDK
+Choose your Java runtime and follow their installation instructions. For example, you could choose:
+
+*  link:http://openjdk.java.net/install/[OpenJDK]
+*  link:http://www.java.com/en/download/manual.jsp[Oracle Java SE]
+
+== Maven
+Follow the official Maven installation guide if you don't already have Maven 3.2 installed.
+
+Run `mvn --version` to check your current Maven version. If you have Maven 3.2 or later, you are ready to go.
+
+== Getting {brandname}
+To start using {brandname}, you can:
+
+* Download the {brandname} server distribution.
+* Pull the {brandname} server Docker image.

timeline.bodyText: if this is only for community, you can put a link to the download page

timeline.bodyText: probably wouldn't hurt to have a link to the "Embedding Infinispan 11.0" page
timeline.author: pruivo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+[id='quick_start']
+= Get Up and Running with {brandname}
+It's easy to get started with {brandname}. All you need is Java, dependency
+management tooling, and either the {brandname} server or core libraries.
+
+== Software Requirements
+
+To run {brandname}, you'll need:
+
+* Java 1.8 JDK at a minimum. {brandname} recommends JDK 11 but also works with JDK 14.
+* Maven 3.2 or later. {brandname} also works with Gradle and Ivy.
+
+== JDK
+Choose your Java runtime and follow their installation instructions. For example, you could choose:
+
+*  link:http://openjdk.java.net/install/[OpenJDK]
+*  link:http://www.java.com/en/download/manual.jsp[Oracle Java SE]
+
+== Maven
+Follow the official Maven installation guide if you don't already have Maven 3.2 installed.
+
+Run `mvn --version` to check your current Maven version. If you have Maven 3.2 or later, you are ready to go.
+
+== Getting {brandname}
+To start using {brandname}, you can:
+
+* Download the {brandname} server distribution.
+* Pull the {brandname} server Docker image.
+* Add the `infinispan-core` artifact to your `pom.xml` and use {brandname} directly in your project.

timeline.bodyText:
IMO, you don't need the second sentence.
quay.io has a list of tags: https://quay.io/repository/infinispan/server?tab=tags
timeline.author: pruivo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+[id='quick_start']
+= Get Up and Running with {brandname}
+It's easy to get started with {brandname}. All you need is Java, dependency
+management tooling, and either the {brandname} server or core libraries.
+
+== Software Requirements
+
+To run {brandname}, you'll need:
+
+* Java 1.8 JDK at a minimum. {brandname} recommends JDK 11 but also works with JDK 14.
+* Maven 3.2 or later. {brandname} also works with Gradle and Ivy.
+
+== JDK
+Choose your Java runtime and follow their installation instructions. For example, you could choose:
+
+*  link:http://openjdk.java.net/install/[OpenJDK]
+*  link:http://www.java.com/en/download/manual.jsp[Oracle Java SE]
+
+== Maven
+Run `mvn --version` to check your current Maven version. If you have Maven 3.2
+or later, you are ready to go.
+
+If you need to install Maven, visit link:https://maven.apache.org/install.html[https://maven.apache.org/install.html].
+
+== Getting {brandname}
+To start using {brandname}, you can:
+
+* Download the {brandname} server distribution. Visit the link:https://infinispan.org/download/[Download {brandname}] page to get a stable or development version.
+* Pull the link:https://quay.io/repository/infinispan/server[{brandname} server image]. Visit the link:https://infinispan.org/download/[Download {brandname}] page to find the latest tagged versions.
